definition: (TCM) observation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
to examine or treat medically

sentences.english: Diagnosis can be made by observing, pressing and measuring the electrical resistance on the auricular points.
sentences.chinese: 通过对耳穴的望诊，压诊，电测等还可用于诊断疾病。

definition: (TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
(TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to feel sb's pulse

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
(TCM) auscultation and smelling, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to feel sb's pulse
to feel (take) the pulse
"eight principles," a method of giving a general description and syndrome differentiation (TCM)
to investigate
palpation (as a method of examination)
holistic diagnosis and treatment (TCM)
pattern-syndrome identification based on the eight principles (TCM)
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
to feel sb's pulse
pulse taken at the wrist (TCM)
